sections.heading: What is 〜ようだ (you da)?
sections.content:
〜ようだ expresses conjecture or inference based on evidence, meaning "it appears," "it seems," or "it looks like." It's the formal equivalent of みたい and indicates a logical conclusion from observation or information.

雨が降るようだ "It appears it will rain" 彼は忙しいようだ "He seems to be busy"

children.heading: With Verbs (Plain Form)
children.content: 降る → 降るようだ "it appears it will rain" 降った → 降ったようだ "it appears it rained" 降らない → 降らないようだ "it appears it won't rain"

children.heading: With I-adjectives
children.content: 高い → 高いようだ "it appears expensive" 高かった → 高かったようだ "it appears it was expensive" 高くない → 高くないようだ "it appears it's not expensive"

children.heading: With Na-adjectives
children.content:
Add な before ようだ:

便利 → 便利なようだ "it appears convenient" 便利だった → 便利だったようだ "it appears it was convenient" 便利じゃない → 便利じゃないようだ "it appears it's not convenient"

children.heading: With Nouns
children.content:
Add の before ようだ:

学生 → 学生のようだ "it appears (he's) a student" 雨 → 雨のようだ "it appears to be rain" 休み → 休みのようだ "it appears to be a holiday"

children.heading: Logical Inference
children.content:
Based on evidence, observation, or information:

雨が降るようだ "It appears it will rain" (based on clouds, forecast) 彼は忙しいようだ "He appears to be busy" (based on his behavior) 誰もいないようだ "It appears nobody's here" (it's quiet)

children.heading: 1. Conjecture/Inference (appears/seems)
children.content: 会議は中止のようです "It appears the meeting is cancelled" 彼は知らないようだ "He seems not to know" 問題があるようです "There appears to be a problem"

children.heading: 2. Similarity (like/similar to)
children.content: 夢のようだ "(It's) like a dream" 子供のような人 "a child-like person" 映画のような話 "a story like a movie"

children.heading: ようです (polite)
children.content: 雨が降るようです "It appears it will rain" 彼は学生のようです "He appears to be a student"

children.heading: ようでございます (very polite)
children.content: 会議は中止のようでございます "It appears the meeting is cancelled"

children.heading: ようだ vs みたい
children.content: ようだ: Formal 雨が降るようだ "It appears it will rain" みたい: Casual 雨が降るみたい "Looks like it will rain"

children.heading: ようだ vs らしい vs そうだ
children.content: ようだ: Logical conclusion from evidence 雨が降るようだ "It appears it will rain" (I see clouds, feel humidity) らしい: Hearsay/inference 雨が降るらしい "Apparently it will rain" (I heard/gathered) そうだ: Direct hearsay 雨が降るそうだ "I heard it will rain" (someone told me)

children.heading: どうやら〜ようだ (it appears that)
children.content:
Emphasizes conclusion:

どうやら雨が降るようだ "It appears it will rain" どうやら間違いのようだ "It appears to be a mistake"

children.heading: 〜ようだが/〜ようですが (it appears, but)
children.content: 雨が降るようだが、出かける "It appears it will rain, but I'll go out" 問題があるようですが、大丈夫ですか？ "There appears to be a problem, but are you okay?"

children.heading: 〜ような + noun
children.content:
Modifying nouns:

夢のような話 "a dream-like story" 映画のような恋 "a movie-like romance" 子供のような笑顔 "a child-like smile"

children.heading: 〜ように (like/in the manner of)
children.content:
Adverb form:

子供のように笑う "laugh like a child" 映画のように美しい "beautiful like a movie"

children.heading: Like/Similar to
children.content: 夢のようだ "(It's) like a dream" 春のような天気 "spring-like weather" 天使のような人 "an angel-like person" 彼のような人 "a person like him"

children.heading: Example 1: Making Inference
children.content: A: 田中さん、今日来る？ "Is Tanaka coming today?" B: 来ないようです。連絡がないので "It appears he won't come. Since there's no contact" A: そうですか "I see"

children.heading: Example 2: Weather
children.content: A: 外の様子は？ "How's it outside?" B: 雨が降りそうなようですね "It appears it's about to rain" A: 傘を持って行きましょう "Let's bring umbrellas"

children.heading: Example 3: Observation
children.content: A: 誰かいますか？ "Is anyone there?" B: いないようです "It appears nobody's there" A: ドアは開いていますか？ "Is the door open?" B: 閉まっているようです "It appears it's closed"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Forgetting な/の with na-adjectives/nouns
children.content: Wrong: 便利ようだ ❌ Right: 便利なようだ ✓ "It appears convenient" Wrong: 学生ようだ ❌ Right: 学生のようだ ✓ "Appears to be a student"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using だ before ようだ
children.content: Wrong: 学生だようだ ❌ Right: 学生のようだ ✓ "Appears to be a student" But for past: Right: 学生だったようだ ✓ "Appeared to be a student"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing with observation そう
children.content: ようだ: Logical inference 雨が降るようだ "It appears it will rain" (multiple signs) そう: Imminent visual observation 雨が降りそう "Looks like it will rain" (very dark sky)

children.heading: 〜ように見える (appears to look)
children.content: 楽しいように見える "Appears to look fun" 若いように見える "Appears to look young"

children.heading: 〜ようなもの (something like)
children.content: 趣味のようなもの "something like a hobby" 友達のようなもの "something like a friend"

children.heading: 〜ようなこと (something like)
children.content: そのようなことを言った "Said something like that" このようなことがあった "Something like this happened"

children.heading: Conjecture
children.content: 来ないようだ "It appears he won't come" おいしくないようだ "It appears it's not delicious" 学生ではないようだ "It appears he's not a student"

children.heading: Similarity
children.content: 夢のようではない "It's not like a dream"

children.heading: 〜ようなら (if it appears)
children.content: 雨が降るようなら、中止します "If it appears it will rain, we'll cancel" 問題があるようなら、教えてください "If there appears to be a problem, please tell me"

children.heading: Casual (ようだ)
children.content: 雨が降るようだ "It appears it will rain"

children.heading: Polite (ようです)
children.content: 雨が降るようです "It appears it will rain"

children.heading: Formal Written
children.content: 調査によると、問題があるようである "According to the survey, there appears to be a problem"

children.heading: Dreams and Fantasy
children.content: 夢のような話 "a dream-like story" 童話のような世界 "a fairy-tale-like world"

children.heading: People Comparisons
children.content: 子供のような人 "a child-like person" 天使のような笑顔 "an angel-like smile" 彼のような人 "a person like him"

children.heading: Nature
children.content: 春のような天気 "spring-like weather" 秋のような涼しさ "autumn-like coolness"

children.heading: Based on Observation
children.content: 空を見ると、雨が降るようだ "Looking at the sky, it appears it will rain" 様子を見ると、忙しいようだ "Looking at the situation, he appears busy"

children.heading: Based on Information
children.content: 話によると、彼は転勤するようだ "According to what I heard, he appears to be transferring"

children.heading: Conjecture
children.content: 雨が降るようです "It appears it will rain" 彼は忙しいようだ "He appears to be busy" 誰もいないようです "It appears nobody's here" 会議は中止のようだ "It appears the meeting is cancelled"

children.heading: Similarity
children.content: 夢のような話 "A dream-like story" 映画のような恋 "A movie-like romance" 春のような天気 "Spring-like weather" 子供のように遊ぶ "Play like a child"

children.heading: Past
children.content: 雨が降ったようだ "It appears it rained" 彼は帰ったようです "It appears he went home" 終わったようだ "It appears it ended"

children.heading: Negative
children.content: 来ないようです "It appears he won't come" おいしくないようだ "It appears it's not delicious" 学生ではないようです "It appears he's not a student"

children.heading: With Evidence
children.content: 空を見ると、雨が降るようです "Looking at the sky, it appears it will rain" 彼の様子を見ると、疲れているようだ "Looking at him, he appears tired" 話を聞くと、問題があるようです "Hearing the story, there appears to be a problem"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜みたい (mitai) - Looks like/seems (casual) 〜そう (sou) - Looks like/I heard 〜らしい (rashii) - Apparently/seems 〜っぽい (ppoi) - Seems like Formal & Written Style - Formal expressions 〜ように見える - Appears to look

examples.sentence: 〜ように見える - Appears to look
